perturbation.original_text:
(g)  "Work  Product"  means any and all Work and  other  items in any form           that Turpin, solely or with others, conceives of, modifies,  develops,           contributes  to, or reduces to practice  during the period of Turpin's           employment with the Company and which:

          (i)  relate,  directly  or  indirectly,  to the  Company's  present or                future foreseeable Business or Research and Development; or

          (ii) result from any work performed by Turpin for the Company;

          whether or not such are made during or after working hours,  on or off           the Company's premises.
perturbation.changed_text:
(g)  "Work  Product"  means any and all Work and  other  items in any form           that Turpin, solely or with others, conceives of, modifies,  develops,           contributes  to, or reduces to practice  during the period of Turpin's           engagement with the Company and which:

          (i)  relate,  directly  or  indirectly,  to the  Company's  present or                future foreseeable Business or Research and Development; or

          (ii) result from any work performed by Turpin for the Company;

          whether or not such are made during or after working hours,  on or off           the Company's premises.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'employment' is replaced with 'engagement'. While seemingly minor, 'employment' implies a specific legal relationship with associated rights and obligations. 'Engagement' is broader and could include consulting or other arrangements with potentially different obligations. This creates ambiguity as to what constitutes the defined period for 'Work Product' creation and ownership, especially if Turpin's relationship shifts.

perturbation.original_text:
Turpin shall deliver to the Company all Work
      Product and Company  Property,  including all originals and copies thereof,
      in Turpin's possession and/or control,  at the request of the Company,  or,
      in the  absence  of  such a  request,  upon  the  termination  of  Turpin's
      employment with the Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
Turpin shall deliver to the Company all Intellectual Creations and Company  Property,  including all originals and copies thereof,
      in Turpin's possession and/or control,  at the request of the Company,  or,
      in the  absence  of  such a  request,  upon  the  termination  of  Turpin's
      employment with the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Work Product' is replaced by 'Intellectual Creations.' The contract defines 'Work Product' specifically, but 'Intellectual Creations' is not defined. This creates ambiguity. Does it include things outside of 'Work,' as defined? Does it exclude some things covered by the definition of "Work Product"? This undermines the explicit, defined scope of return obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
Termination under this Section 12 shall be effective from the date
      written  notice is delivered or the date  specified in the written  notice.
      whichever is later.
perturbation.changed_text:
Termination under this Section 7 shall be effective from the date
      written  notice is delivered or the date  specified in the written  notice.
      whichever is later.
perturbation.explanation: Changing Section 12 to Section 7 creates a contradiction because the text references termination under itself, which would be section 7, but in the original document, it was Section 12. This may require judicial interpretation of intent, leading to uncertainty.
